results.title: Emanuel Feuermann: cellist
results.creator_credit: Ernst Matray, Rudolph Polk, Walter Lowendahl and Artists Films
results.brief_description: Emanuel Feuermann, internationally known cellist, plays Dvorak’s Rondo, Opus 94, Spinning Song by Popper. He is accompanied by Theodore Saidenberg at the piano.

results.title: Elvis on tour
results.creator_credit: Robert Abel, Pierre Adigel and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Presents a portrait of Elvis Presley’s life. Shows Elvis speaking publicly for the first time about his life and career; rare footage of his early days; performance of his greatest hits including “Love me tender” and offstage moments.

results.title: Elvis: That's the way it is (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Denis Sanders, Rick Schmidlin and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Elvis: That’s the way it is is a remastered, special edition of the original. This edition includes special features such as the original theatrical trailer and the restored documentary, “Patch it up: The restoration of ‘Elvis: That’s the way it is’”. The documentary is a great introduction to the original picture, providing insights into Elvis the performer, both on stage and in rehearsal. Those who worked and performed with Elvis add an intimacy that only further draws the viewer into the world of Elvis. His masterful performance and ease with the camera makes the feature throughly entertaining for both Elvis enthusiasts and novice alike.

results.title: Elton John live in Australia. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: This concert, in December 1986, before a capacity audience in the Sydney Entertainment Centre, was part of the “Tour de Force” series. Elton and his band are accompanied by the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra under the baton of conductor James Newton Howard. Rated: G

results.title: Elsie
results.brief_description:
Combining 2D art with abstract stylised 3D Elsie’s world is immersive and slightly disturbing as the audience receives a taste of walking in her shoes and seeing with her eyes.
Imagination and reality collide as the race to find the parents she ironically avoids from the evil clutches of her neighbours, the Fenwrights, begins.

results.title: Elton John live in Australia. Pt. 1
results.brief_description: This concert, on December 14th 1986, before 11,000 people in the Sydney Entertainment Centre, was the last in the “Tour de Force”, a series of 27 performances covering all of Australia. This video is of the first half of the show which featured Elton and his 13 piece band. The whole show was also being televised live, via satellite, to an estimated audience of over 10 million people. Rated: G

results.title: Elizabethan stage: Henry V [study extract]
results.brief_description: The opening sequence of Olivier’s film version of “Henry V”. A remarkable recreation of Shakespeare’s London, showing the first part of the play as it may well have been produced originally on the stage of the Globe Theatre. Olivier’s treatment has been very free, and many amusing sidelights on the actors and audiences of Shakespeare’s day are included. Cast includes Laurence Olivier, Robert Helpmann, Leslie Banks, Quentin Crisp.

results.title: Elevator Operator – Courtney Barnett
results.brief_description: Courtney Barnett’s ‘Elevator Operator’ (2016) leans hard into theatrical inspirations like the work of Wes Anderson and features familiar screen faces like Madgda Szubanski, Sleater-Kinney, Tim Rogers, Paul Kelly and Michael Leunig as they travel through the elevator in Melbourne’s Nicholas Building.

constellations_primary.name: Elevator Operator: Up and down, the on-screen gift of elevators
constellations_primary.description: Inspired by Courtney Barnett playing an elevator operator in her hit song of the same name, we look at how they're used on-screen for comedy, drama and suspense, with the small, confined boxes forcing characters to physically confront each other.

results.description: The music video as a mini movie is an enduring concept within the genre, first achieving mainstream popularity with Michael Jackson’s Thriller (1983). This idea was toyed with in Courtney Barnett’s Elevator Operator(2016), which leans hard into theatrical inspirations like the work of Wes Anderson and features familiar screen faces like Madgda Szubanski, Sleater-Kinney, Tim Rogers, Paul Kelly and Michael Leunig as they travel through the elevator in Melbourne’s Nicholas Building.

results.title: Elements organised: the periodic table
results.creator_credit: David Jackson, Tony Jolly, BBC and Open University
results.brief_description: A series of excellent demonstrations, with graphics, showing how the great variety in the behaviour of the elements can be organised into a systematic structure, the Periodic Table. Please note that there is some background noise on the tape. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Elements of survival. Part 1. Populations
results.creator_credit: Doug Lower and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: First of a two-part series this episode focuses on the population spiral and looks at mankind from pre-history to the present explosion with its doubling of world population about every 35 years. The film looks at the possible consequences of unchecked growth, and the wide gulf between the haves and the have-nots.
